snippet: The choices offered by the Affordable Care Act are leading some small companies, which don’t have to offer health benefits, to drop their employee plans.
abstract: Choices offered by the Affordable Care Act are leading some small companies, which do not have to offer health benefits, to drop their employee plans; health insurance is one of their biggest expenses; only 38 percent of American firms with fewer than 50 workers provided health insurance in 2011, down from 47 percent in 2001.
lead_paragraph: The choices offered by the Affordable Care Act are leading some small companies, which don’t have to offer health benefits, to drop their employee plans.

headline.main: Dropping Health Plans, to Pick Better Coverage
headline.print_headline: Dropping Health Plans, To Pick Better Coverage

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
